node.title: Al Unser, 4-Time Winner of Indy 500, Dies at 82
node.alt: Al Unser Sr. in 1987 after winning his fourth Indianapolis 500, a total achieved by only three other drivers.
node.description: Mr. Unser was part of one of auto racingâ€™s most celebrated families, whose members won the Indianapolis 500 a combined nine times.
node.content: ["Al Unser Sr., one of only four drivers to win the Indianapolis 500 four times and a stalwart of one of auto racing\u2019s most accomplished families, died on Thursday. He was 82.", "He died at his home in Chama, N.M., The Associated Press reported, citing the Indianapolis Motor Speedway. He had cancer.", "Mr. Unser\u2019s four Indianapolis 500 wins came in 1970, 1971, 1978 and 1987. The final victory made him the oldest driver, at 47, to win the United States\u2019 premier auto race.", "In all, more than a dozen members of the Unser family would work in auto racing, including all three of Mr. Unser\u2019s brothers. His older brother Bobby, who himself won the Indianapolis 500 three times, called the 1987 race on TV for a national audience.", "Mr. Unser won that race competing against his son, Al Unser Jr., who finished fourth that year and would go on to become one of the world\u2019s premier drivers, twice winning the Indianapolis 500. They shared the track several times, and the father assumed the nickname Big Al after his son, nicknamed Little Al, established himself in racing.", "At the Beatrice Indy Challenge in 1985, Mr. Unser pulled up next to his son toward the end of the race. They briefly looked directly at each other, gave each other a wave, and Mr. Unser pulled ahead and won the race, The A.P. reported.", "\u201cI\u2019ve really got mixed emotions,\u201d the elder Mr. Unser said after the race. \u201cI\u2019d like to have seen Al win. Championships are hard to come by.\u201d", "He added: \u201cStill, I\u2019m a racer and I have to race. I said yesterday, if he wins it, he\u2019s going to have to earn it.\u201d", "Al Unser Sr. was born in Albuquerque in 1939. His father, Jerry Unser, who owned a gas station and was an occasional racer and car builder, set him and his brothers on the path to racing royalty.", "His brother Bobby said in 2009 that he and Al did not fight and were \u201cthe closest of friends.\u201d Al Unser passed on his love of racing to his son, helping the younger Al with a kart he began racing when he was 9.", "Mr. Unser became at least the third member of the family to die this year. Bobby died in May at 87, and his son Bobby Unser Jr. died in June at 65.", "Al Unser first competed in the Indianapolis 500 in 1965, running in every race for decades except in 1969, when he broke his leg in a motorcycle accident, and in 1991, when he did not have a car. He led for 644 laps over his career, which remains a record. ", "Mr. Unser\u2019s four wins at the Indianapolis 500 is a record shared by A.J. Foyt, Rick Mears and Helio Castroneves, who won this year\u2019s race.", "Mr. Unser retired in 1994 and lived in Albuquerque with his wife, Susan. Information about his survivors was not immediately available."]
